Description: Stuccoed wooden female figure; lower legs missing; split vertically.
Excavator/field collector: Excavated by: Dr David George Hogarth
Curator's comments: No tomb number on object, but exactly matches Hogarth's description of 'Half of a good wood female figure split down through middle and feet and arms gone.'
Bibliographic references: Zitman 2010 / The necropolis of Assiut: a case study of local Egyptian funerary culture from the Old Kingdom to the end of the Middle Kingdom (II, 222)
